I don't know if they work for anti-fatigue because they hurt my feet and I can only wear these shoes for about an hour at a time. I suppose it will be like when I was a kid in the summer and at first it hurt to go barefoot outside but after a while your feet toughen up and it stops hurting. Not thrilled though to have paid money for shoes that my feet have to toughen up for. They are also a lot hotter to wear than my old Crocs. Not sure if it's because of the smaller size or the new material. Overall, I'm very unhappy with these shoes. Looks like I'll have to find a replacement for my old Crocs elsewhere.
Cute color but I wish they weren't defective. Left shoe was great. right shoe was all messed up. My daughter was going to wear them putbthem on and we realized it was no good.
Disappointed with this purchase as the right shoe is dented a little. It’s not a big deal but I’m a perfectionist so it’s killing me inside every time I look at them.

The cushioning in these latest crocs is less than what it had been in 2023. There is no way to add increased cushioning without causing compression of the top of the foot against the top of the croc. I will not be buying these in the future. I will be going with Duflex clogs, even though they are more expensive.

se indican unos tamaños que te pueden confundir si son de hombre o mujer o trae mas de dos letras identificativas al tiempo y no logras definir si es la talla o no por lo que puedes traer a tu casa el producto equivocado con la consecuente devolucion espera de devolucion de fondos a tus cuentas y demas.
I ordered a new pair, was sent a used pair. A heavily used pair at that, the soles aren't just dirty, they're starting to wear away.
I orderred the chocolate color and they send like a charcoal
Cool and Comfy for a minute. But when you were for a whole day, the rubber irritates on the foot, and makes it super uncomfortable
Like walking on a bed of nails. I returned them. I have an older pair of Crocs that I love. Very comfortable.
My 14 year old ordered a pair they were not the same size as her other pair of crocs so they don’t even fit her

These Crocs broke after only about 10 short wears. Unfortunately, by the time it happened, it was outside of the Amazon 30-day return window, and when I contacted Crocs directly, they said any return would have to be done through Amazon, even though Crocs has a 90-day warranty on their products. Just something to think about if you are buying Crocs from 3rd party sellers. Disappointed we are stuck with broken shoes when it is obvious there was a quality issue from the beginning.
But nor fast enough for growing feet . They were to small so we needed a larger size.

The bumps on the inside of the shoes are so stiff and tall that they remind me of walking on a non slip carpet chairmat which is upside down. They hurt!

If this were my first pair I wouldn't order more.
Beware no 1/2 sizes. I wear 9.5. Got a 10–too big, exchanged for a 9–too small
On top of not being in on time, they messed up the order. And got me the wrong size. But they redeem themselves when they shipped out the new pair the right size. Overall, the product is good.
got a size up from my regular shoe size & and came smaller.

column2: The ridges were too hard to walk on
column8: The color was good - the crocs hurt the bottom of my feet
I bought these crocs for my husband five months ago. Overtime one crock has shrunk significantly so he can no longer wear them. Just wanted to share my feelings about this defective product.

column2: The insole nubs hurt my feet
column8: Years ago I lived in my crocs, so I ordered me a new pair, thinking they were of the same quality. Wrong! There are huge nubs throughout the insole, which hurt my feet a great deal. Useless in the warmer months. There nubs, I've discovered are suppose to massage feet! I can wear with socks 😏 however. The rubber isn't as spongy & soft as I remember & I was unable to find the open toe sandal style I wore some 15 years ago. I'm extremely disappointed. Only kept them to wear during the winter months to slip on to do laundry or get my mail. If you have sensitive feet or neuropathy these aren't for you!
The crocs are huge for a size 7 in women. My daughter was very excited waiting for her crocs to arrive. However, the crocs do not fit right. They run too big
I bought these for my daughter. We ordered 9 women/7 men. They fit lime a women's 6. Waiting for my sons crocs to arrive so I can check the size on those.

I feel like there was a point where Crocs where reputable and reliable but that isn't the case anymore. I found older Crocs that were created prior to COVID are cheaply made and shouldn't have been released. It's so cheaply made that the back straps when walking always detach leaving the latch whacking your ankle as you walk.

They fit perfect out of the box! But then they shrunk. Might be hard to tell the size difference with my old (blue) vs new (brown), but my heal no longer fits in them ),: - After experiencing the size difference I read a few reviews about some batches shrinking in the sun. What a waist of materials! And a bummer to be a long time crocs supporter, but now questioning the quality control. If I ever buy crocs again it will be in the winter so hopefully they won’t shrink after a long break in period. Either way I shouldn’t have to think this strategically about a pair of shoes

column2: Don't fit well or feel good
column8: I'm a half-size and ordered both the size below and the size above, since they don't come in half-sizes. Neither worked. The smaller one had my heel trapped in too closely to the end, and the larger one was just too large and my feet were sliding all around inside, which was not at all comfortable to walk in. I have a pretty wide foot, and they offered plenty of room width-wise, so that was not a problem. The length as the main issue. They're also ugly, which I could put up with if they had a fantastic fit, but they did not work out for me.

column2: Plastic clip that holds the strap broke after 2 months
column8: Crocs quality has gone way down, and the prices have gone up! We won’t be buying any more of these. My kids lived in Crocs when they were little, and my daughter wore a pair of hand me downs for a year and a half before I bought her a new pair for Christmas. The new ones looked ok but in less than three months, the plastic clip on the side broke. I missed the return window on Amazon so I contacted Crocs directly and they informed me that they only do returns or exchanges within 90 days of purchase. Since this was a Christmas gift, I bought them pretty far ahead of time and missed that window as well. Not happy with the quality, not happy with the customer service.

These were nice when new. Granddaughter wearing for only 8 wks. and snap that hooks the croc strap to the shoe broke. I shouldn't have to be trying to rig these myself after only 8 wks of occasional wear. I've owned my crocs for 11yrs and never a problem like this.

I am like Goldie locks, you name it I’ve tried almost every brand of shoe out there. Kurus, Hoka, and shoes for crews are my favorite for different reasons. I had to give up Hokas because the price is high, and the shoes don’t last as long as + they start to slide as they were down. The best slip resistant shoes I ever wore were Shoes for crews, but they are more work shoes. So I decided to try Brooks because my runner friends like them. They are comfortable and great to walk in, But and this is a big But, if it rains and the ground gets wet, they have no slip resistant soles. I actually had a hard time getting home because I was sliding on the wet ground. Very scary because I walk to keep in shape, but what good is that going to do if I fall and get hurt. My son has brooks also and he told me the same thing happens to him. These shoes are brand new, so there should be no reason that you slide in them. Who makes a running shoe that has no grip? Very disappointed because I bought 3 different Brooks to see which one I liked.

This shoe has a huge cushion on the outside and the toe box is larger than the Ghost 15. I returned it because it wasn't a good fit for me and don't like that the Brooks Ghost is no longer streamlined. I see that this is a trend in other brands also. I'll look for something that fits well and looks like a normal running/walking" shoe. Really an ugly shoe."

column2: Narrow in the inner arch area
column8:
They are comfortable. But, as your feet get swollen throught the day, the inner shoe base pushes on the side of the arch and causes tremendous pain.

I want to try a 9xw but I do not think that is going to solve the problem in the arch area. It will probably just be an even wider toe box.

Bought to replace my beloved Ghost 13s. Different fit w wider toe box and uncomfortable tongue and area around ankle when worn for first time today. WORST of all? This pair squeaks w each step even walking slowly on carpet. Deal breaker.
Not sure what is happening with these but they are substantially smaller than the Brooks Ghost 12 that I purchased a few years ago. Tighter in the toe box and shorter length. Going back.
I wished I brought a wide shoe. 8 regular is tight on me. The shoes were very comfortable the first time wearing them. Took a while to break them in.

column2: Fit not what it used to be when compared the Brooks Ghost 14.
column8: The quality of the shoes is fine but Brooks must have changed their manufacturer because the fit has changed. I’ve worn Brooks Ghost shoes for many years. Now I find the toe box too wide and my feet keep sliding forward. Not at all comfortable for an expensive athletic shoe. So sad. Now I have to go in search of new shoes.
Not ask comfortable as past ghost

This was my fifth or sixth order of Brooks, my first Ghost 16. I always had purchased Ghost 15. The Ghost 16 felt different, lesser than others, right out of the box and to my great dismay were a little short. I’m returning and sticking with Ghost 15 for as long as they’re available.

This is my second pairs of Brooks women's shoes. However the shoes are not good for driving. The first one is very good for walking and driving. I do not recommend buying these styles of Brooks Shoes.

I have been wearing brooks for over 5 years. I buy the ghost the number is up to 16 now.
This pair hurts my feet. What changed?
Arrived in a plastic bag and smooshed in! Have other Brooks Ghost design and they had much better arch support. Sending these back. Disappointed
Nice shoe but too small. Returned but have not got credit to my account yet
I bought these because they were recommended for plantar fasciitis but they actually made it worse.

column2: Not like my other Ghost 16 that I bought locally
column8: I purchased these Brook's Ghost 16 three months ago because I have a pair that I bought locally and they are so comfortable. These Brook's, however, are killing my knees! I'm sitting here again with a heating pad on my knees. I even went to the doctor to see if I have rheumatoid or an injury. Nope. It's the shoes. These shoes must be factory seconds. Not the same in our local shoe stores. Dissatisfied.

I absolutely loved the Brooks ghost 13 so when those wore out, I bought myself the 14 version. There were a few changes to that version that made it very uncomfortable, particularly with the back lip of the sneaker being curved in and rubbing my ankle and causing blisters so those went back. I went to another brand for a while, but really wanted to try the ghost again, but sadly, the same issue remains. The bottom of the shoe is incredibly supportive, but it’s very hard and after a while, it becomes uncomfortable and the same back lip issue persists. I got terrible blisters the first time I wore these. I don’t know why they changed the shoe and why manufacturers don’t realize that the back part of the shoe shouldn’t curve in. Bo more Brooks for me.

I’m a nurse and work 12 hour shifts. Bought a black pair, same brand, style and size at a shoe store so I knew this would be perfect for work. However, I am having to “break” these in longer? So I am just giving it 3 stars
I liked the shoes but bought the wrong size. I decided I need to shop in person in the future as I require support inserts in my shoes.

I have worn the Ghosts for running over the years. They have always been comfortable right out of the box with just the right amount of cushioning and sole support. However, the new Ghost 16 is not the same shoe! The toe box feels different. There is less flexibility in the material. It almost feels like a full plastic layer in the toe box. It has caused blisters and calluses, which I have never had with older generation Ghosts. I tried giving it more time than usual to break in, but it's still uncomfortable. Disappointed.
Extremely comfortable, feel just like my Ghost 14’s! But - these run a half size too small.

column2: The Ghost 16 toe bed feels narrower
column8: In the past few decades, I have been through several cycles of searching for the perfect running shoe, finding a good one, getting a pair or two a year, and then struggling when the companies have narrowed the toe bed. (Why on earth do they keep doing that?). For years, I was a faithful Asics runner. Then the toe bed started pinching my feet. After some trying on lots of shoes, I found the Brooks Ghost line. I have had about 7 or 8 pairs. It feels like the Ghost 16 is tighter than my previous Ghosts (recently, a few pairs of the Ghost 15). I will wear this pair, but am already starting my search at local stores for a new brand and model.
Returned this item. Very comfortable but do not like the style

column2: The shoe laces are too short
column8: The shoe laces are too short .

column2: I’m not sure they are authentic Brooks sneakers
column8:
I’ve been wearing brooks for 10+ years
I’m on my feet all day long these are very different from previous ghosts I’ve purchased
1 they are the slipperiest brooks I’ve ever owned
Leaving some safety concerns when working on wet areas
2 the toe area gets dented and requires manual correction I’m not sure how that area will wear in the future
The comfort level is decent and it was hard to find ghosts that weren’t white in my size I’m just left wondering did brooks go down hill or are these not authentic

column2: Good working shoes for12 hour shift
column8: Comfortable

I wore around the house for a bit just to find out if I like them. Toe box larger than previous Brooks athletic shoes that I have owned. I usually prefer Brooks to any other brand, but I am not a fan of the Ghost 16.

I’m a longtime Ghost user and have owned the Ghost 12, 13, and 14—I’ve loved them all. I especially appreciate the cushioning; walking in them feels like floating on clouds, even during long walks. Unfortunately, the Ghost 16 was really disappointing. The sizing runs much smaller than usual, even though I ordered the wide version. They also lack the soft, cushiony feel that I’ve come to expect from this line. It doesn’t feel like a Ghost shoe at all. What happened to our dream shoes, Brooks Ghost?

I have wore the shows for 2 months now to work and can leave a honest review. I work 10 hour days. In the beginning they were the best feeling shoe I have ever wore but I want to say after a month inside stopped be soft/cushioned. Shoe+shipping, I paid $155 for them to last a month. These pictures are of current conditions. Only wore them for work and I have started to wear the tread off after to month. Not worth the price. I can buy $80 pair new balance that last longer.

Not for me. They felt fine while walking around the house. Like walking on air. I decided to keep them. Unfortunately things went downhill from there. Walking outside I found them to rub different areas of my feet. After a 20 minute walk my feet were in agony. I thought maybe they just needed some breaking in. No! They are still painful to my feet and my wallet. Not for me.

I own Brooks Ghost Max 2 and I really love them. But it’s a bit expensive so I went with Max 16 thinking it’s a less cushioned version of Ghost Max 2. But they are completely different shoes. Max 16 runs narrow and short and hard. Over all they are very uncomfortable and made my feet really hurt after walking for 20 min. I’d pay a little more and get Ghost Max 2.

column2: Not as supportive as I had hoped
column8: I have the misfortune of dealing with sciatica, so I was hoping to find a more supportive walking shoe so I could stay active without causing my sciatica to flare. Unfortunately, after wearing one time, my sciatica flared up the next day. The shoe hit me in a very uncomfortable spot under my ankle and overall did not give the support I was looking for. Will be returning.

column2: not as good as previous versions
column8: I have owned the 13's in size 9 wide and 14's in 9.5 wide as I was told they were smaller. They both had immediate cushion for someone with flat feet who is not a runner. I tried these in a 9 and 9.5 wide but they felt lumpy, for lack of a better word. I am hoping the next iteration is more like the old.

They are just ok. Lucky with the thin socks I have on the ones the shipped just fit. I think I would have liked a little more room, but wore they out trying them. I try putting foam in the sole because they are not as comfortable as the last brooks pair I got.
Don’t really like the texture of this style sneaker

column2: Love Brooks but not the Ghost 16
column8: I only wear Brooks. Loved the 15s and the adrenaline. I was very disappointed in these …. They just don’t provide the support the other models have. I will be going back to the Adrenalines.
They look great, are true to size, but the bottoms of my feet hurt after wearing for just an hour. I wore them to volunteer at a food pantry and by the end of the shift I was very sore.

column2: Comfortable but nit a good fit!
column8: I recently ordered these shoes and the toebox was very wide. Felt sloppy on my feet. Returned and got a refund.

I have purchased Brooks shoes for years. My first set was a pair of Ghost several years ago that lasted me a few years. I then purchased Launch GTS about 2 years ago. I needed a new pair and have always wanted to go back to Ghost, but this new model of Ghost fits wildly different. I have always been a size 9B in Brooks. The first pair I ordered, were WAY too small and narrow. I returned and replaced them with 9.5W, and they still fit uncomfortably. I wondered if this was potentially an Amazon issue, so I took a look at recent reviews of the Ghost and even other models on the Brooks website, and there were so many recent reviews all pointing out that new models of shoes are much smaller, narrower, and fit differently in the arch. This was incredibly disappointing because I loved the brand, and I loved the style of the shoe. I think I will be moving on to other brands of running shoes.
Very disappointed in seeing dirt encrusted and on the sole of the shoe and a falling apart box. I expect at least a clean shoe when it is advertised as new.
I generally love brooks shoes, but these have clearly been worn before I received them. There is black hair inside both shoes and they did not come in brooks packaging.

I've worn the ghost 15s for two years and they were perfect. Would walk 5-10 miles in them every day and I'm so upset they are no longer made. The Ghost 16s are horrible. Not only do you have to size up with these, but you have to go up in the width as well because they are much narrower than the Ghost 15. Not sure what the hell they did to the cushion either, but the days I wore the Ghost 16s, my knees kept snapping whenever i squatted down (felt like knife digging into knee). The days I wore the Ghost 15s, I've had no issues with my knees. Additionally, the toe box is very different with the 16s; there's some hard material in there that when touched, it'll leave a dent that will be felt by the toes and does not pop back out unless you take the shoes off and manually pop it back out with your fingers.
Not really good. Hard to put on have to turn foot sideways to get foot in to get on. Then the back doesn't stay up when up put then on.
They are sooo cute but run a little small. I’m normally a size 8 in tennis shoes but had to go up 1/2 a size because they are more narrow at the end , They also make my feet very hot!!

column2: Great support, but gave me blisters
column8: I have a lot of feet problems due to my really high arches, but these are so comfortable and have great support. I’m giving 3 stars because they gave me extremely painful blisters (like couldn’t walk for two days painful). I will be wearing blister pads with these from now on so I don’t go through that again.
I have ordered about 10 pairs of Brooks over the last 4 years. These just don't fit the same? The support is not as good as others and the sneaker feels rather stiff. Not a fan.

I usually love Brooks shoes but these just did not work for me. I tried really hard to be able to wear them, but after about 20 minutes my feet hurt. Not sure what makes this style different than other Brooks shoes, but something must be different.

Can it be that Brooks Ghost series have gotten narrower in the toe box than in years past? I have worn Brooks Ghost for ages but my review is for Ghost 16 in the wide width. I have never had this problem before but the show in the wide width is not wide enough to comfortably accomodate my orthotics. Will keep the shoe but have to wear it w/o the orthotics which is a bummer.

I had brooks shoes and loved them. I work in a school kitchen so moving alot, so ordered brooks against and after the second day with these shoes my feet started to ache. Highly disappointed and won't order brooks again
Have worn Brooks Ghost for years. Ordered same specs as Ghost 12. Quality lower, fit not the same, less arch support. Returning.

Bought these in a narrow width as recommended by RUN TO THE FINISH for 'best' narrow width women's running shoes. It was clear the moment i put them on that they would not be narrow enough. Of course each person's feet are different. Was able to return them.
Smaller than my normal daily shoes size I wear a 10 in woman's and these were to small
Overall a great shoe but this newest model is too wide in the toe and forefoot.

I have bought Brooks for years. This last pair are terrible. I have had them for 5 months and they have 2 holes in 2 different places. I can no longer wear them to work in because they look terrible! I don't know if they changed manufactures or fabric, but I will be getting something different from now on.
Loved the shoe, but I am needing a wider size.
Not what I expected. I wanted a good running shoe to use on the treadmill. I've been wearing daily for over a month and my feet hurt. Really not worth the price you pay.
Did not fit regarding plantar fasciitis
This is the 6th pair of same style and same size Brooks Ghost athletic shoes I’ve purchased beginning with Ghost 7. The Ghost 16 are 1/2 to 1 size shorter than all the previous ones.

I have very picky feet and legs. These are beautiful, well made, but a little narrow in the toes. Also, they are a little too spongey for me and were pulling my knee, so I returned them. I love the Glycerin, so will probably stick with that style.

column2: Sizing much smaller than previous Ghost models
column8: I've had the Brooks Ghost 14 and 15, so I ordered Ghost 16 in the same size as my previous ones. The ones I ordered are extremely tight, unwearable.
Too wide, they are giving me blisters :(
These are nice shoes but definitely fit smaller than ghost 14. Kept them but regret not returning them. I will have to get a different pair soon.

column5: Great shoes. Great support at balls of feet! Great for walking. Using these shoes for our Disneyworld vacation! Shoes fit great!
column8: I was looking forward to my first pair of brooks, and was disappointed. They fit, but no support on balls of feet. I could feel the ground I walk on. I did return and bought a different brooks shoes and love it!

As an older female with some back issues I was looking for a good pair of running shoes with lots of cushion to make the jog smoother and less jarring. These are unfortunately pretty hard and stiff. I don't feel any soft cushion under my soles and they're not very flexible. So far all I've done is long walks in them (3-4 miles at a time) and they are less comfortable than my old Sauconys which were about $50 cheaper. These also run a little short. I went up a 1/2 size as I usually do for running shoes and my big toe is grazing the front end. Not worth the extra price.
I have ordered multiple Brooks tennis shoes & love them. This pair was the wrong size & width. It said 8 wide but I wear 8.5 wide. There was no way these were wide width. Returned them.

column2: I’ve been buying brooks ghost for several years and these do not fit the same
column8: I have a narrow foot and purchased a 11 1/2 N. These were to wide and didn’t fit at all like my ghost 13. I ended up getting the Adrenaline 22 style and the fit was good.
They are comfortable and have a nice wide tobox and they fit my orthotics, but they are so noisy. I wear them anyway but sometimes the noisy makes me want to tiss them or at the least take them off.

column2: Received clearly flawed/irregular product with questionable origins
column8:
The product I received was flawed/irregular, ie., not properly sized and with glue clearly protruding along seams. Despite the indication that the product was from the Brooks store (via Amazon), it arrived oddly packaged, the box covered in shrink wrap with information listing an entirely different company.
Returned this inferior product to Amazon and reordered directly from Brooks. The far superior product I received from Brooks, eg, properly sized and no glue visible, only further confirmed that I had received a flawed product from Amazon.
I now order directly from Brooks, rather than via Amazon.

column2: Not the same as older Ghost shoes
column8: Much less supportive and doesn't feel like the same quality. Also HOT compared to the older version.

column2: I like the roomy toe box but not durable
column8: The shoe was comfy but not worth the money if it will only last me a little over a month in use. I don’t drag my feet and this is just from consistent walking 4-10 miles and I switched every other day with another shoe and that shoe doesn’t look like this. Not worth the money if I will need to replace too frequently
Runs at least one full size short!

When I first bought these shoes, I was really pleased with them. I even bought a second pair in a different color. But after wearing these for about a month, the sole of the shoe is already breaking down. Unfortunately, they are hurting the ball of my foot whereas before they were very very comfortable. I wear these shoes every single day so that might be part of it but at this price point they should last for several months. I don’t run or do any heavy workouts. I just use them for walking short distances and around the house.
Not very comfortable. Will not buy these again. They feel like my shoes when I need to replace them. I usually lose brooks ghost shoes.

Brooks Women’s Ghost 16 Neutral Running Shoe. I gave them a stellar review when I first purchased them because thy immediately fit me. These were one of the top five. When I used a website for the best rated shoes that help with pronated ankles and was linked to Amazon.

I only use them for walking. I have been wearing the same style of Brooks Ghost shoe for 6 years and decided to get the updated ones for the wider toe box. I plan to go to Italy this year and thought the lighter weight would be an added bonus to pack.

In less than a week, these were showing wear. The sole was crushing down. The my previous shoe's soles, for lack of a better description, made with a dense rubber. These have a light weight, and I think low quality sole. I felt that they were stiff and I cannot imagine running in them.

I have been wearing Brook Ghost for years treating myself to a new pair each year, same size no issue. The Ghost16 is so narrow in the toe box and overall not the supportive, stabilizing fit of past Ghost. I tried my new 16 this morning for my workout and they were pinching my toes and my feet hurt. I wish I could return them.

I’ve been wearing Brooks for over 15 years, this is the first pair I put on and wasn’t instantly gratified. I hope they just need to be worn in, but the right foot it feels like the shoe keeps sliding and doesn’t fit securely. I’m not happy right now. And I’m already in my trip and can’t return. I love Brooks but wow so so sad this isn’t a good fit. Idk what to do as this is my only pair of active shoes for my trip…
Not a comfortable shoe for me. Toe box is too wide, shoe length is a tad too short, and it's too bouncy.
It showed a gray shoe. It actually looks white in person.

column2: These running shoes are not a proper fit for me
column8: They hurt my foot so bad I couldn’t wear them
This was my 4th or 5th ghost purchase but had to return this year’s edition. It runs large

I purchased these in wide. It seems that Brooks wide is no longer wide enough. I was disappointed because I’ve bought these in the past. My foot hasn’t changed and I don’t have unusually wide feet. I had to send them back.

column2: Extremely Disappointing Change to a Beloved Shoe
column8: Brooks Ghost has been my beloved walking/running shoe for years. I recently needed a new pair and purchased Brooks Ghost 16, in my usual size. I could not figure out why they weren't comfortable and kept adjusting the laces, changing socks. I finally compared the tongue of these shoes to a prior pair of Brooks 11 (see photos). The Brooks 16 tongue is lined with a different material which is thinner and rougher. It has less padding in the tongue and when the tongue bunches up it rubs and is very rough. The shoes are not wearable and I'm returning. So, so disappointing.
Quality of the soles are not what I'm used to with Brooks. These are only good for walking.

This shoe is short. I have Ghost 15. So comfortable. Ghost 16 was uncomfortable the moment I put them on. My foot hit the end and I went up a size. Why did Brooks ruin a good shoe with Ghost 15? Luckily found one to purchase. Change the shoe back please!

I have worn Brooks Ghost for many years and the Ghost 16 does not seem to be the same quality as the previous versions of this shoe. I have run in the Ghost 13, 14, and 15 and loved this running shoe. The changes made for the 16 has caused issues with my feet and back.

Big regret. Which is unfortunate because of all the fantastic reviews throughout the whole internet. This is my second time running 4 miles and I’ve been in excruciating pain. I am trying to push through as I hope this doesn’t end my running journey.
I have the same pair in the same size in grey and i love them... for whatever reason after wearing these these ones make the balls of my feet go numb as soon as a put them on. So uncomfortable.

These were too big, when i tried to return them, it was going to cost 62$ to return so then, and they only offered to reimburse 20$. I'm very frustrated and can't figure out how to connect the seller.

column2: Someone bought these shoes for me
column8: The shoes were not the right size for me and were black. I don’t wear black shoes. They were also more costly than what I usually buy. I’m sure they are very good shoes that will last for years, but I don’t wear black tennis type shoes.

column2: Quality vs price not worth it
column8: I’ve only had these shoes for about a month and they are already worn down and uncomfortable. The prices of these shoes vs the quality of them is unreal. They were super comfy for about a week or 2.
This does not look as strong as the previous one’s
The left shoe fit is poor. The outside of the opening of the shoe hits my ankle bone where it's irritating. The right foot is a perfect fit.
Have had 2 months already feel like they have broken down. I clean houses , wear daily. Will be going back to Hokas
It’s not as comfy as the reviews say. So disappointing, for such an expensive shoe. I feel like Goldilocks - New Balance is too soft, Brooks are too hard. Athletic shoes are too complicated.

I had a very disappointing experience. Within an hour of wearing them, I developed a blister, which has never happened to me before. I returned the shoes the next day and am still waiting for my refund(told it could take up to a month)which has been frustrating. I hope this is just an isolated incident.
Been wearing Ghost 15 for years. Love these. The Ghost 16 hurt my feet all over. Brooks destroyed a good, comfortable shoe.
I returned this item because I didn't like the fit. I had ghost 15s prior to ordering these and I'm not a fan on the changes they made like a lower heel and they're slightly narrower than the 15s.

I dont know what happened to brooks quality, but this is not it. The soles are comfy, but, the top incredibly cheaply made and scratchy. The tongue of the shoe where its sewn looks like it might unravel at any second. With proper wear, I don't see how these can last more than a month before they would fall apart. I am disappointed.

This is the second pair of brooks I have bought. The first pair was amazing. I was so impressed which is why I bought this pair. They look identical so I don’t know why these were so bad. But after two months they have worn down and are no longer comfortable! My last pair lasted me almost a year and through pregnancy . My activity level has not changed. I work 12 hours on my feet as a nurse. These were so disappointing for the price I paid..
Ive been wearing brooks for years. Ive also worn a 7.5 my entire adult life (which is longer than I care to admit). These are HUGE. Theres 1.5 or so left in the toe. what happened?!"
I’m so disappointed the brooks ghost has always been my go to but these fit terribly and hurt my feet i’m taking them back right now I don’t really understand why the fit is so terrible

column2: The leg holes are TIGHT and may cut off your circulation and/or give you blood clots!
column8: The leg holes are TIGHT and may cut off your circulation and/or give you blood clots! I may be a fat who wears 2XL, but almost all my fat is in my belly. For a bigger guy, my legs are relatively skinny, but when I sit down for more than a few minutes in these boxer briefs, I can see the lines left in my legs where it was cutting off my circulation. I bought Hanes boxer briefs from elsewhere (Wal-mart) before and never had this problem. I still have some pairs to compare and see the legs have much more room in the old ones. I don't know if Hanes was trying to save a little money by cutting the cloth a bit tighter in the legs, but I hope they get sued if someone loses a leg or dies from a blood clot. I don't know if it was just this horrible batch, the Amazon seller, or Hanes that made the change to cutting off circulation, but I went with a different brand, hoping for better results. I'm debating seeing if I can get a refund on these, but I feel awkward returning undies that I tried for a few times hoping they would loosen up and not kill me. Spending another 20-30 bucks on a better pair might save life and limb, though.

column2: These are the most uncomfortable pair of underwear I have ever worn
column8:
Title: Disappointing Experience with Hanes Underwear

Rating: ★★☆☆☆

I recently purchased a pack of Hanes underwear with high hopes, given the brand's reputation for comfort and quality. Unfortunately, my experience was far from satisfactory, leaving me with no choice but to share my disappointment.

The most glaring issue was the poor fit of the underwear. Despite selecting the correct size based on the sizing chart, I found the underwear to be uncomfortably tight and restrictive. The waistband dug into my skin, causing discomfort throughout the day. It was surprising to encounter such a basic fit problem from a brand like Hanes, known for its commitment to providing comfortable undergarments.

The restrictive nature of the underwear also made it challenging to move freely. Whether sitting for an extended period or engaging in physical activities, the underwear failed to provide the flexibility and ease of movement that one would expect. This lack of comfort was a constant reminder of the poor fit, making it difficult to go about daily activities without feeling constantly bothered.

Another notable issue was the overall quality of the material. The fabric used in these particular Hanes underwear felt cheap and lacked the softness that the brand is typically associated with. After just a few washes, I noticed signs of wear and tear, further adding to my dissatisfaction.

In summary, my experience with Hanes underwear was disappointing, primarily due to the poor fit, restrictive design, and subpar quality of the material. For a brand that has built its reputation on comfort, this particular product fell short of expectations. I would caution others to carefully consider their options before choosing Hanes for their underwear needs, as my experience suggests that not all products from this brand live up to its well-established reputation.

column2: What the heck Hanes, whats with the sizing shrink?
column8: What the heck Hanes? Been buying XXL Hanes a long time and this latest purchase does not come close to fitting. Serious exposure on the back side with slightest bend. So I laid them side side with by last Hanes purchase and some Polo underwear. Photo speaks volumes. Yes, I realize the older ones stretch with age, but they were new a one point and fit perfect. How do I get my money back if I tossed the packaging because I assumed it was Hanes with years of experience fits. Stupid me, an now I need to hit or miss sizing on another brand to settle on.

Let me start out by saying that there are three different types in this one pack. The first being that the grey pair has a different material makeup. I noticed this in the description and is not a big deal. Now let's get to the other two...

First the red, blue, and green: these three pairs have weird stitching along the bottom of the leg holes. Due to the stitch type, they do not stretch. I work in the textile manufacturing field with sewing operations and this is not something that I would expect on this type of clothing. I am an average size person (6 foot tall, 200 pounds) and these boxers are uncomfortably tight on the thighs. So tight that I actually debated leaving work on lunch break to go home and change. Maybe these are a good fit for chicken little or someone without legs? Also they are a little tight in other areas with very little stretch it you catch my drift.

The black and grey pairs have a normal stitch along the legs which allow them to stretch and fit. A better fit in the thighs, but still tight in other areas.

Rating was reduced to one star, because there is no indication of no star: Length for warmth. But no front support, just loose fitting. There is perfect feeling of fit and assurance, on the legs. But on the front, where it matters, there is the absence of feeling, the sensation of discomfort because there’s no credible specific support. Colors or style, or contrast stitching don't matter. It's what counts. The photos showing the presumption of a front, contoured support, do not 'support' the actual garment itself. There isn't any of the picture contour of the front that exists when wearing this undergarment. Candidly, it should be the form of a cup, that actually acts like like a supportive sewn in area. Akin, politely said, to a brassiere, that should have the support feature yet it's only a loose fitting fabric that offers no assurances. Let this be a lesson for the ones who sell mens' underwear: Tell the truth about your product, that it performs when the product is worn.

Since the Stay-At-Home deal some of us have gained a little weight, so, to keep up with my body type I purchased a bunch of Gray G2000 'T' shirts. These gray shirts looked and fit great even after machine washing. I decided to buy a bunch of white G2000 'T' shirts to tie-dye. The Gildan White G2000 aren't made like the Gray G2000 'T' shirts. The gray were a heavier grade cotton, with better stitching et cetera. So, I thought that I'd get some of the same type in White. I was extremely disappointed in the quality of the shirts that I received, not only were they of cheaper quality cotton, synthetic thread was used to stitch to shirt which shows up like a spot light (when tie-dyed)because (of course) synthetic thread will not take up Procion MX dye. If the shirt description states 100% cotton the shirt should be 100% cotton, otherwise the description should state that the shirt stitching is synthetic and not 100% cotton. There should be no difference in quality of materials between the 2 colors of shirts but there was. The difference in a tie-dye between a quality white shirt and the Gilda G2000 is night and day. I feel 'sullied and unclean' for having used the White G2000 'T' shirts. One can be sure that I will no longer use the Gildan product even to clean the floor.
So, no i'm not happy with this product at all. Each time I wear one of these shirts i'll be reminded of my disappointment when I see the sleeve, neck and tail stitching.
One shirt came with a hole in it.
This item is not ultra cotton!!! It is heavy cotton!!! The company told me to return these and they sent me the wrong material again!! False advertising!!!

I gave these shirts a go because Everlast apparently stopped making their plain tshirts (which fit awesomely, and more importantly, were soft). These shirts were a stark contrast from the Everlast to the Gildan brand. The first thing I noticed, was that the cotton used was rough, like hay rough. Maybe they processed the cotton along with the rest of the plant to save money, who knows. All I know, is if you're fond of softer shirts, these shirts aren't what you want. On top of that, their fit is ridiculous. I'm of skinny-ish athletic build, and the sleeves at the shoulders squeezed my arms, which bunched up the shirt needlessly; while the neck was too tight, as well. I'm a size large, and have been most of my adult life; and these shirts fit like a medium or similar, even before washing them. Combined with the rough hay-like fibers, these shirts were horrible. Peasants in medieval times might have liked them, but this is 2023. There's just no excuse for a tshirt that feels like hay in this day and age.

The collars were very droopy. Very droopy.

You know how most shirts that fit well have a lower neckline in the front. When I say most, I mean all except these shirts. I washed them in cold water and hung them on the line to dry. The material is great, but its like they sewed two back halves together and forgot that the neckline in the front of the shirt should be lower. This must mean that they sewed an equal number of shirts together using two front pieces. Or their design doesn't include having a front or back to the shirt. There is no tailoring whatsoever in these shirts. Worst shirts I have ever purchased. I tried all three out and only had them on for a minute before I knew these were really poorly made. Anyway, they are now going in my shop rag pile because you can't wear them without being choked from the collar. I guess I could give them someone I don't like?

These are not green, they are yellow!

I purchased a package of undershirts from a discount store near me by this manufacturer and absolutely love them. Perfectly sized, they are also incredibly soft. So, I decided I wanted more of them and ordered them on Amazon. Same look, same size, same manufacturer and I HATE them. Not the same at all! These are coarse ... not soft in the least. They feel like burlap. I had been confident enough that I ordered six of them. Now I have a steady supply of rags for the near future. I couldn't be more disappointed. Last time I order anything made by Gildan. STAY AWAY!!!

I have bought these before and everything was good. This time though, you can tell the material is cheaper. Very thin, but I thought ok I’ll use them as a pajama top. I washed them in cold water and I air dried them. They would fit a child now. No joke. So I’m not stuck with them as I washed them. Plus they are not shipped directly from Amazon so there’s that too.

GILDAN continues to be a second tier brand in terms of quality. The tee shirt feels heavy and like cardboard, rough on the skin. I had poor experiences with GILDAN a few years ago but decided to give them another shot based on price. You get what you pay for.
It is worth spending a little more and getting higher quality. I sincerely do not understand people giving this tee shirt a good review. It would seem they have no experience with quality and or have low expectations.
I was looking for something with a little more quality. After one was they shrunk and not good what so ever to just wear as a tee shirt

Amazon suggested to get a size up with this shirt, but I HIGHLY recommend getting the size you wear normally. BUT that's if you want to look like someone wearing a cardboard box cutout of a shirt all day. I was hoping this was more form fitting but they aren't. Gildan has always been boxey shirts and this one is no different. It's also HUGE and a XL fit like a XXL. Disappointed as I already washed and dried them (medium heat to hopefully shrink some) but they just don't fit right.
I will be using these for paint projects, wrenching on cars etc… terrible shirts.
I ordered another brand of shirts with these and these run very small
Not soft at all and they are scratchy. Would not purchase again !!!
The shirts smell like they came out of a petroleum refinery!

The color is great but the shirt is that weird kind of cotton that gets stiffer with washing. It's become very uncomfortable for a t-shirt and I'm going to have to pitch it. A waste of money for sure.
Fabric is stiff and becomes even stiffer with each wash.
My white shirts arrived with black dots on them.
La tela de rompe a la tercera lavada

i finally got something that didn't satisfy me. this shirt was rather quite coarse on me skin, very itchy n abrasive. Gild ultra-cotton is not for me, i guess. while i didn't contact the seller, i gave only 1 star because of the feeling of the shirt: uncomfortable. will not buy these kinds of shirts again. altho that's out n well enough, there r other items by this seller i can look at for the future. but i won't buy this kind of shirt again =(
The ONE shirt I received was exactly what I needed, but I paid for a 2 pack. What a bummer

Bought many Gildan shirts in the past. This one had inaccurate color and ribbed neckline trim stitching unraveled first time wearing creating big holes. Probably seconds or some other inferior product. Bad news.

Ordered, ridiculous, return difficult. Paid a buck and waited for a return label which never came and was informed that another one couldn’t be sent. So in addition to maybe 45 min total time two calls i’ll have to drive somewhere for them to print a label then drive to the ups store to drop off.
The product is sub-par, the material heavy & chafing. The sleeves are excessively wide and long. The torso has no cut but resembles this wide straight tube. Maybe it’s cheaper to manufacture this way or maybe some people like it. In either case be warned that returns are not like a simple drop off at Kohls as Amazon normally does.

Falsely advertised as 100% cotton. All over the page it says 100% cotton, but in 1 spot it says the 100% cotton is only for certain colors. The t-shirts i got ended up being 50% polyester, not soft, kind of scratchy. I washed them before i tried them on and they were unraveling. Threads coming out of the collar and sticking up all over the shirt, making it even scratchier. Also it fits weird, like the neck line in the front is too high. I would not suggest anyone buy this product, and if you do, double check if your color is 100% cotton or not.

Gildan was my last bastion of hope for a well-made t-shirt, and now they don't even make the cut.
I sweat in my Ts and the collar immediately started curling/folding under--after washing it stayed that way. Shirt fit okay but they need to work on their collars...ALL CHINESE TSHIRTS SUCK!

I received these heavy cotton black Gildan T-shirts and was shocked at how cheap and terrible they fit as compared to the same t-shirts I ordered 2 years ago that were a much heavier cotton and very comfortable. The black color now is more like a dark gray and the material is thin and rigid. Bring back the old material and solid colors Gildan used to offer! I'm returning these immediately.
Shrunk drastically after one wash. Looks like a belly shirt now and is unwearable.

This is the fourth package of these tee-shirts I have purchase, but they have changed the thickness and neck dimensions. I have had to send 2 packages back and I used to love them. The neck looks stretched out fresh out of the package,

I bought these in white and they look like a dingy white like they’ve been worn and sweated in. Unfortunately I’m in a time crunch and needed them for a project to be worn once so I can’t return them but very disappointed
I recieved used faded shirts with the tags cut out of them. Returned
It arrived a day late. Then I had to wash because of off gases. Then it was not long enough to even tuck into pants. You just need to be shorter or have a short torso to like this shirt.
The G2000 shirts I received have Gildan Ultra Cotton" on the first tag
column5: but the second tag notes that they are 50% polyester. That wasn't what I expected
column7: given that the product page for the 2 pack says "100% cotton" everywhere.

column4: It’s came with just one, previously opened and thrown back in. I ordered a size 4. The one I did receive was a very rough material. Feels horrible on skin. It is short I’m am 5”8 and the size was a little tight also. I will be returning what did show up. I don’t remember this if you want something that feels nice and flatters your body.
Shirt sizing was fine, but one of the two shirts was stained. I needed the other shirt so I couldn’t return them. Disappointed.
The color is way off. I wish I hadn’t bought long sleeve/short sleeve and sweatshirts in this Brand before receiving the first .

I purchased these shirts and only had the 1 month. They are getting holes where the seams are. I would say it was a bad pack, but my sister drought the same ones and hers is doing the same thing. We brought them to do our company shirts. So now I'm out of money for the shirts and getting my company on them.

I bought these black shirts for my bf and had high expectations due to all the positive reviews. However, I was quickly disappointed because the shirt, fresh out the package, had white stuff on it. My bf is very detail oriented and brought it to me showing the white crap. What is it? And why it is on a brand new shirt out the plastic??

Also my bf is 6'2 and the shirt is too short as it hits above the belt. So anytime he reaches for something or just raises his arms up, the shirt goes way up, exposing his stomach.

I think I'll stick with Kingstead shirts from now on. Even though they are more expensive, they have better quality, clean and ready to wear out the package and fits him perfectly where it falls below the belt.

I had purchased Gildan tee shirts in the past and they were perfect. They must have changed the formula because these feel like cardboard, and do not have the stretch and softness that they originally had. Must be another company cutting quality for profit. Lost money. From now on, I'm sending stuff back when they change and ruin everything that used to be good just to make profit. They need to warn people and they didn't so I am.
These are a replica of Gildan!!!!

Son has an all white activity and no time to exchange so he is stuck going to school with a shirt that haves a yellowish tone to them and the difference from the pants is obvious, he has autism and the texture bothers him but he really wants to participate so hopefully he gets through the day with them, and they run small he's M but I got it L and they still to tights for comfort

The shirt is fine - typical plain blue shirt. But I ordered a 2 pack and only 1 was sent. I reached out to the customer service department, but haven’t gotten a response yet. Trying to get product help through Amazon just leads me to Gildan’s website. Be warned if you’re needing 2 of the same shirt.

I received two T-shirts loose in a mailing envelope and they are nothing like the Guildans I already have in other colors. I had to wash them before wearing because they smelled strange and they are now one full size smaller than my order. I would not buy again from this private seller. Wasted money.
I actually liked these upon first arrival, but after wearing and washing only once, all 3 shirts have holes in the armpit where the seam is coming undone. Will be returning.
I removed this from the dryer, on gentle, low heat, after a normal wash cycle. The threads are already pulling out of the seams. I wouldn’t recommended these.
My first time buying these shirts in color, not happy black spot stains everywhere.

Initially, I liked them the fabric felt nice and heavy enough for the price The fit was good as well. having washed and worn them to only twice. One of them has a hole in the collar or the collar meets the front panel already starting to separate

These t-shirts are of cheap quality. They shrunk after the 1st use and the shape is too boxy. Also, the color was off. I didn’t care for it. Do yourself a favor and spend a little more for better quality or go two sizes bigger.
Ordered multiple packs in different sizes. Some of the shirts came damaged with holes, loose thread, tears, etc. Next time I will just go shop in person

I assume Gilden makes different quality for different purposes, because the printed ones when we do events for work, have no issues. These however shrunk from men's large to kid's small in one wash, and they got VERY rough, like sandpaper- and trust me, my wife uses Downy like it free. Returning them

I should have realized a $5 shirt is like a $1000 dollar car :(

I figured Galapagos Blue would be considered a solid, which according to the description, was 100% cotton. I'm going on vacation to a really hot, humid location. I don't need polyester shirts that are sticking to me. Worst buy EVER!!!!
No way these are new looks like they been washed 100 times I’m sending them back today don’t get if you want black t shirts

Gildan cotton T shirts for men (lt gray and navy blue) -- contrary to other reviews, these shirts are not at all soft; they scratch even after washing. The collar tags do not tear out. Also contrary to other reviews, the shirts are not loose" in fit
column7: they are rather snug and this user is thin and lean. I would not buy this brand again."

column4: The quality of the fabric is so disappointing. Was hoping they would soften and be less stiff and scratchy after washing, but unfortunately they remain gross. Wish I could return them, definitely would not purchase Gildan again.

Washed and dried the heck out of these t-shirts, and the material is still rough. They must leave some short fibers in the shirt, since it sometimes feels like there are small needles against my skin.
The texture of the fabric was very unpleasant to wear.

I have had 4 of these shirts for a few months and the seams are tearing out at the top of the shoulder. I only wear them about once a month as part of a uniform, so they have not had a lot of usage and washings. These shirts replaced the 'exact same' ones that had lasted me with similar usage for over 5 years! There is no way to contact Gildan via Amazon and Amazon obviously only supports 30 days for returns. Find a better quality brand - apparently Gildan has decided to steer away from it.
Shirt was like a neon construction yellow, not green at all.
Bought two packs for a cheer performance outfit. Small pack was good, medium pack had MULTIPLE stains on both shirts that were brown like the picture all over. Not great since they are white shirts.

These shirts felt like burlap and shrunk at least a full size or more after washing in cold water and drying on low heat.
The seller would not allow a refund or return since it had been washed. It is unreasonable not to refund money on products that can be worn only once and then not fit after they are washed. How am I supposed to foresee the inferior quality and shrinkage before it is washed?
For a couple dollars more, get Fruit Of The Loom t-shirts. They are softer and more comfortable. Plus, they don't shrink much at all, if any.

I was looking to replace some red heathered Mossimo Athletic Fit T-Shirts that I really liked, which apparently they no longer make. Compared to those, the sleeves on these just don't fit nicely; the ends are to wide and they flop around a bit instead of following the curve of the arm. The color is much brighter than the picture which looks to me almost maroon. I got the Antique Cherry Red, and I guess the red does indeed look like a bright artificial cherry red lipstick, with black specs. The threading is in a lighter shade of red, and the overall effect is just blech. Unlike the picture, this also has a white tag on the inside back of the collar, which the Mossimo shirts don't (they have a tagless label). I always have to remove such tags, which sometimes damages the shirt. I ended up returning the 2-pack.
Buy Fruit of the Loom instead. You will be happier with their softness. The Gildan look fine just not comfortable--it is like they made it of twigs instead of a nice cotton.

This is the roughest t-shirt material I've ever seen or felt. I gave it 2 months, hoping they would soften up in the wash, but these are just crappy.

I've manufactured t-shirts for department stores, and made a wardrobe of record company-issued promotional t-shirts; I've bought t-shirts at downtown LA swap meets, street vendors, and online from manufacturers like this one. These are the worst.
Wouldn't buy again. Very coarse feel.
The order I received is super disappointing and sketchy. Tell my why the T shirt tag is missing, and why the shirts are different in fabric thickness and collar. I want a refund!

I'm a big tall guy. I'm used to costco's t-shirts. Costco changed theirs (not for the better), so I went looking for a replacement. These are not it. Here is what I don't like: They're cut as short as they can get away with. The shirts don't feel like they're going to last very long. I feel like I'm going to accidentally tear them. They are not very soft.

In essence, they're a cheap screen-printing t-shirt. I don't like screen-printing t-shirts. I wish I had gone with my gut and sent them back instead of trying to tough it out.

I'm a big dude, I've tried my best to lose weight and never could until recently when I realized I had an actual medical condition that was preventing me from losing weight. I have been working on it, and throughout all these years of not knowing it was always hard finding shirts that fit well.
These shirts came and I was so happy, they fit snug, I didn't feel sad, or self conscious about how small it felt. Sadly however the seems on all 4 of my shirts came in already falling apart. The stitch looks like it just wasn't done properly and they're all just rapidly coming undone.
I ordered a few different types of Gildan shirts and the G2000 is by far the worst. I'm average size (5-9
column5: 175 lbs) and usually wear large. These shrunk so much after washing that they turned into a medium at best. Very short in overall length and the sleeves stick out in a weird way. Dont buy these unless you're short and wide"

column4: When I opened the package the shirts had dog hair all on the backs of both of them. They also ran super small and short. Would not buy again.
The large for this shirt fits like a XXL. Not to mention, I ordered the 2 pack and only received one shirt. Not too sure about this product.
I am a big fan of Gildan, but this one was huge compared to other Large t-shirts I own from Gildan. May it was mislabeled :(

I thought these were undershirts. Undershirts are obviously made to go under another shirt. These are so thick with huge bulky tags. These are meant to be printed on and sold for promotional purposes. This is not a shirt you want to wear under anything and highly recommend you seek something else.

I have been looking for a plain good tshirt, Walmart brand “George” are soft and feel like stretch Cotten but are not in stock. I opted for gildan ultra soft and stretch cotton but they are horrible loose fitting, thin, no shape just a cinder block. Will be returning

While the T-shirt’s are good, the packaging was horrible! They were delivered in a baggie that was thinner than a piece of paper. There were multiple holes in the bag and it wasn’t even tapped shut. It wasn’t delivered in any kind of secure packaging. It was raining when it was delivered and therefore my shirts were soaked. I would never buy these again!

Gildan has decided to engage in shrinkflation sending lower quality shirts unfortunately. If you are looking for the ultra cotton heavy weight G2000 shirts they are now sending a lighter fabric version which feels thin and cheap at the same price. Beware of this shady tactic.
Have you ever looked at a big pile of sand and thought to yourself That would make a great t-shirt!"? If so
column5: these are the shirts for you.

column4: I don't know much about stitching fabrics, but I know my t shirts usually last longer than one wash before falling apart. 2 of my 3 pack have holes in the collar after 1 wash. Right along the seam, they just started unraveling.

I received these this week. They looked good out of the bag. Their vivid red color looks exactly as pictured. They seemed to be a good buy, especially on the lightning deal. I'm glad that I soaked them in cold water for an hour or two before putting them in the washing machine - they shed a lot of red into the sink. After seeing all that red I washed them only with other red clothes the first time. I will update this review if I discover something wrong with them... update: after only one laundering the collar rolled over, making the shirt look sloppy. I'll reserve these as at home lounging/sleeping, washing the car wear, etc. I won't wear these in public. Unfortunately, this is a case of you get what you pay for. My Champion shirts look much better.

I’ve ordered Gilman t shirts before for work and cannot figure out which ones they were. They were comfortable, fit well and lasted a long time. These are not them lol. These feel like wearing sand paper no matter how many times washed, and they don’t fit properly either. The shoulders and arms are too tight but not in a good way to accent the arms. It somehow looks too big while still restricting movement. I’ll probably donate them since they’re too uncomfortable to wear even for garage or yard work.

Wanted a comfortable, reasonably soft t-shirt. I was deciding between medium and large. I went with the large (2 black and 2 white) and they a bit too small. Much smaller than any of the other shirts I own. The material is very scratchy and uncomfortable. The neck is too tight. Very unpleasant feeling to wear. I am used to buying inexpensive t-shirts, and t-shirts I have bought for similar prices from Walmart (their store brand) are significantly softer and better fit. I don't want to go through the hassle of returning these, so I guess I just wasted my money.

column8:
The design on these shoes is amazing!

I have not noticed any slipperiness and they are fairly easy to walk around in. I always wear socks with mine, and I do not walk particularly long distances, however. I am not sure that I would recommend doing this – walking long distances or walking in these for hours on end. I can also see how if by some chance you chose to run in them, these Crocs would possibly not hold up well, or could hurt your feet.

I believe, based off what I read – and based off what I have seen – as having been what Crocs were initially used for (boating shoes?), that they would not make good athletic shoes.

The sizing is perfect for me. I wear a size 9.5 in sneakers. But with the Classic Crocs, I chose to size up. This leaves plenty of extra space for my feet, but not so much that there is a fall risk.

Many might find if they wear half sizes that it is helpful to size down instead. But sizing up led to my Crocs being more comfortable for me personally, overall. I have average-sized feet.

They aren’t super wide or narrow, and purchasing Crocs cuts down on foot pain and such. I should add that I suffered a foot injury a couple months back, which I am not fully recovered from. These shoes are heavenly compared with most shoes I have worn.

Normally, when outdoors for only a few minutes in my other shoes that are not Crocs, I experience some foot pain or discomfort immediately after. This has not been my personal experience with Crocs. Although these particular ones may be slightly less durable than another pair I own, the Stomps.

I am absolutely bananas for Crocs!
Lol.

🧡

~ Polly

column2: Comfort, Durability, and Style – Yellow Crocs are a Game-Changer!
column8:
I’ve been a long-time fan of Crocs, but these yellow ones have truly won me over for both their comfort and style. I’ve worn them on multiple occasions, from casual outings to quick trips around the house, and they’ve held up beautifully while keeping my feet happy the whole time.

The comfort is unbeatable. The Croslite foam construction offers soft cushioning with every step, making these perfect for extended wear. Whether I’m running errands or standing for long periods, my feet never feel fatigued. The adjustable strap in the back allows for a custom fit, keeping them securely on my feet without feeling too tight. The arch support is surprisingly good for a casual shoe, which is a huge plus.

Despite being made of lightweight material, these Crocs are incredibly durable. I’ve worn them in various environments—wet and dry—and they still look brand new. They’re easy to clean (a quick rinse with water and they’re good to go), and the soles offer excellent traction, making them suitable for both indoor and outdoor use. They’ve handled everything from beach trips to quick walks without showing any signs of wear.

The bright yellow color is a fun, bold choice. While Crocs are known for their quirky style, I find the yellow to be surprisingly versatile. It’s a cheerful pop of color that can complement a casual summer outfit, or just add a bit of flair to a laid-back day around the house. They’re perfect for anyone who wants to stand out with something more playful and vibrant.

These yellow Crocs are more than just a fashion statement; they combine comfort, durability, and style in one easy-to-wear shoe. Whether you’re lounging at home, heading to the beach, or running errands, they’re the perfect footwear for effortless, all-day comfort. I couldn’t be happier with my purchase and would highly recommend them to anyone who values comfort and a bit of fun in their footwear!

column2: The kids (teens) love them and wear them daily. As Advertised. Shipped and Received Right Away.
column8: I have ordered several pairs several times. Typically we have decent luck with size/fitting (we order the M13 & M16) with the original style Crocs brand. Both kids have wide feet and the original are great since some of the other styles are narrower. Nice and lightweight. Both kids wear them nearly everyday so they last pretty well but get a little slick on the bottom if they get worn down a lot. Shipped very fast and arrived the next day. Better price than a lot of places for size and color.

column2: Great fit, lovely colors and long lasting. Crocs are a great buy. . . .
column8:
If you have never worn Crocs you are missing a wonderful experience. I wore Croc for years as they were great for a variety of activities, indoor and outdoors. I gave up my last pair several years ago due to fair wear of the crocs. i wore them everywhere, indoors and outdoors. Comfortable and can wear with or without light socks. I prefer without socks!
I realized this past month that I really missed having Crocs to wear around the house instead of slippers. Crocs last a lot longer than slippers! They may not be as cozy as slippers but wearing them with socks for warmth in the Winter is totally acceptable. Thank you Amazon for selling this great product in my favorite color of PURPLE, they arrived today and I love them. They are great year round and last a lot longer than slippers even outside!!!

column2: A Very Comfortable Shoe All Around
column8: I love these shoes...They are so comfortable. They are true to size. If you are a women and you wear a size 9, order a 9 because a 10 will be too large. Crocs are easy to slip on and keep on with the strap that can be worn over the shoe or behind the shoe. The styles and designs are nice. They are very durable, easy to keep clean, and the arch support is good. I highly recommend buying Crocs, you will not regret it.

The Crocs are great! Fit good, thickness of sole is good, and they are very lightweight and comfortable. Zero complaints about quality!
I bought the red Crocs, but they really aren't red, more of a pastel red or dark pink. But not traditional red , more towards the pink side for sure. I don't see myself wearing these out and about, as dark pink isn't really my color. Though around the house I couldn't care what color they are.
Super happy with the quality, but had to knock off a star due to the color
As usually the quality is top tier! Size is perfect, they are comfy, durable, and always a great value for the dollar
I'm usually a 9.5 so I got the 10 and it was huge so I'm returning it for a 9. Might even have to go down another size. These run pretty big. Comfortable though!

column2: Newbie Croc wearer answers common questions
column8:
SIZING + FIT: 1) I wear an exact women’s size 8.5. Sometimes size 9 so I can add a Dr Scholl arch insole. I ordered these Crocs in two different sizes so I could try them and return the size that didn’t work. The size women’s 9 was too large/loose. The size women’s 8 fit me best, but not perfect. 2) The right shoe is somewhat larger & looser than the left, and the heel strap is longer. 3) I tried inserting a Dr Scholl insole in these Crocs. It did make the shoes more snug on my feet, and added arch support. The insoles stayed in place. But, it just felt wrong to put an insole in a Croc shoe since I bought these for orthopedic comfort & support, so I removed them. 4) My husband also just ordered these exact Crocs from Amazon in size Men's 11. He normally wears a size 10.5 or 11 shoe. They fit him okay, but they are somewhat loose on his narrow feet and he ends up walking duck-footed, with his toes pointed outward, to keep them from slipping.

COMFORT: 1) After reading A LOT of reviews, I concluded that the comfort of Crocs are unique to each person. People with wider feet seem to really love them. People with foot or back problems love them. People with narrower feet aren’t usually impressed by them. 2) I sit & stand at my desk all day and these shoes are more comfortable than flip flops, but not as comfortable as high quality sneakers. 3) I have high arches and these shoes are tolerable, but don’t really offer much arch support. Perhaps my feet will eventually mold to the rubber – time will tell. 4) These Crocs have a slight cushioned insole. They are not hard plastic, and the insole has a little bit of cushy give when I take a step. 5) When wearing these shoes for extended periods, I notice pain in the ball of my feet - metatarsals. 6) The little nubs inside these shoes are soft enough that they don’t bother me or hurt my feet. That says a lot because I have very sensitive feet! 7) I find these shoes to be more comfortable and slip less when I wear them with socks. 8) I have a knock-off brand of Crocs with removeable orthopedic insoles. Those were initially comfortable on my feet, but the longer I wore them the more my feet hurt. The knock-off brand cost MORE than these Crocs ($33 vs $26).

LOOKS + COLOR: 1) Well, what can I really say here except I really didn’t buy these for looks. They look like wide orthopedic shoes. Oh yeah, that’s because they are! Comfort overruled style in my case. 2) I bought some cute white flower charms on Amazon and that made my Crocs look more feminine and added a little something that was needed. 3) I ordered these in the color CHOCOLATE because I wanted a neutral color that didn’t draw attention to my huge orthopedic shoes. In the listing photo they look kind of sparkly, but they aren’t. They are a light, soft brown, almost a taupe color. Later, IF this shoe style grows on me (remember, I’m a newbie Crock wearer) I may try some other fun colors like pink or red.

OTHER + GOOD TO KNOW + TIPS: 1) As other reviewers mention, these shoes squeak as you walk. Each step is “squeak, squeak, squeak…”. 2) In my opinion, Crocs are not ideal for narrow feet like mine. The shoes feel loose and I had them slip off while walking, which could be hazardous. I would not walk in these shoes for long distances or on uneven ground or on steps. 3) I heard that Crocs can be loosened or tightened using a blow dryer or in a clothes dryer. I tried to tighten mine using a blow dryer on high heat, held 6 inches away, then let cool. I was hoping the material would slightly shrink, especially the heel strap which is too loose. Unfortunately, this heat method did not work for me. *If you try this, USE CAUTION so you don't ruin your shoes! 4) I read many reviews where people said their Crocs shrunk or warped when left out in the sun or in a hot vehicle , so keep that in mind. 5) The holes in the plastic help ventilate enough that my feet don’t get super hot. Yes, my feet sweat a little in these shoes. There is a slight foot odor when wearing without socks. That is to be expected with rubber shoes. 6) I prefer to wear these shoes with socks because it helps with sweating and my feet don’t slip as much. 7) The tag on these shoes says Made in China. The bottom of the shoe is imprinted with Made in China. They have a tag that warns about riding on escalators and holding children’s hands at all times. I would never wear these on an escalator, but there must be some reason they include this tag – probably because of known issues of the rubber soles getting stuck on escalators. 8) I have no idea if these are “authentic” Crocs because this is my first pair and I have nothing to compare to. I checked the official Crocs’ website and the shoes I received from Amazon look exactly like those on Crocs’ website. 9) At the time of this review, I paid $26 for these Crocs on Amazon. This same style on the official Crocs’ website is priced much higher at $49. Amazon offers a lot more color options than Crocs’ website. 10) I found where Amazon sells a slightly different style of Croc brand shoes that I might try “Crocs Unisex-Adult All Terrain Clogs with Adjustable Heel Strap”. The adjustable heel strap may help in keeping my feet from sliding around. That style is a lot pricier at $41.

IN CONCLUSION: As a newbie Croc wearer, I am not totally convinced these shoes live up to all the hype and amazing reviews I read. Like I said, I don’t think these are ideal for my narrow feet. I don’t feel safe wearing these outside my house because my feet slip in them so much. I will most likely wear these inside my house, inside my RV or around the campsite. PS- I am really disappointed that these didn’t meet all my expectations, and I am envious of all the people who rave about these shoes.

I paid full price for these Crocs and was not compensated in any way for this review. I hope you found it helpful.

These shoes are so comfortable. This is probably my third pair. I wear them inside of the house. And I did slip on water once. But it's only happened once in the last three years. The downside is, well, they look like Crocs and for a guy. That may be. Tough to handle. To be honest. I don't wear them in front of my friends and even when I check my mail I take them off. And my mailbox is attached to my house right outside my front door. I just can't risk it. It was delivered in a box wrapped in a plastic bag. And even though it was box was wet, the bag was completely dry. New line this is my third pair so I will definitely buy more. As needed, I use them for recovery from plantar fasciitis.

column2: My kids love them and that's all that matters!

Personally I don't like them that much I don't like the texture that's on the bottom of your foot it feels funky to me so I won't wear them but my son really loves them and my daughter she enjoys them too I don't know how these shoes got so popular but my God they are. I am an avid croc wearer. Wear them basically everyday. My last pair, I bought about 1.5-2 years ago, lost the tread on the bottom so it was time for a new pair. Ordered these and they were quite a bit snugger. I thought it was all in my head. It had bought the same size as last time but I thought it was in my head. I went to a local shoe store to get something and the salesperson confirmed that she also recently had to get a new pair and she had to size up as well. So just be aware that if it’s been a while since you got a pair, you may need to size up.

I like them so much that I will probably pick up some different colors. I will add that I like the ones with the vent holes much more than the work ones without the holes.

column2: Comfortable shoe for navigating bursitis with style and comfort.
column8: After trying several brands of Crocs, I found these that are lighter weight and roomie. I am a 8.5 shoe but ordered the 9 to have more room. This allows me the extra space to use an insert and socks should I wish. The insert makes em super cloud like and with the cute decorative bling, I couldn't have asked for more! The navy blue is darker than the pic but with the bling looks kickin!

column2: Swore I’d Never Wear Crocs… Now I Barely Take Them Off
column8:
I used to laugh at Crocs. “Not me,” I said. “Never.” Then, in a moment of weakness, I slipped my feet into a pair. Now? I wear them anywhere and everywhere…errands, the backyard, even places where I probably shouldn’t be wearing Crocs but do anyway. Comfort over pride, folks. Easy to clean, ridiculously comfortable, and somehow the most practical shoe in existence. If you’re on the fence, just give in. Resistance is futile.

Would I buy another pair?… I already have.

A year later and they are still holding up well for my 10 year old granddaughter. And she's so rough on shoes. Came back to buy her a few more pairs in different colors. She would wear these year round if I let her

column2: My go-to post-op foot surgery footwear
column8: I recently had foot surgery & my foot was too swollen to fit in my shoes, so I bought Crocs for the 1st time in my life. They solved the problem. Easy to put my foot into them, light, no pressure on incision area, & well priced. Love them.
